subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Cole's Funny Picture Book
msgSnippet: to:  Jeff Smith Jeff: I downloaded your QS converter.  I thought I had tried it before, but I couldn t find it on my computer.  It worked for text I typed in,
messageBody:
to: Jeff Smith

Jeff:

I downloaded your QS converter. I thought I had tried it before, but I
couldn't find it on my computer. It worked for text I typed in, but I
could not get cut and paste to work. If I copied something from a
wordperfect file, I could not paste it into the upper segment of the
converter screen. I tried right clicking in that box, and nothing
happened and there is no pull down menu to allow one to choose "paste."
What am I doing wrong?

I agree with you. While it is necessary to learn to write phonemically
in QS, I believe building reading speed needs a lot of practice, and
using your converter would make that easy to come up with reading
material. Of course, it helps if it can be pasted in as your suggest
rather than having to type it in Roman first.

I think we also should provide a number of short examples for group
members to use as practice readings. If most of the people signed on
this list, would download your converter, pick out a brief passage which
they enjoy, we could have quite a bit of reading material in a brief
time. I would encourage everyone to do this.

Paige
